class forecaster.canada.accounts.registered_account.RegisteredAccount(*args, inflation_adjust=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.contribution_limited.ContributionLimitAccount

An abstract base class for RRSPs, TFSAs, etc.

__init__(*args, inflation_adjust=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Inits RegisteredAccount.

See documentation for Account and ContributionLimitAccount for information on any args not listed below.

Parameters:inflation_adjust –

A method with the following form: inflation_adjust(val, this_year, target_year).

Returns a Decimal object which is the inflation- adjustment factor from base_year to target_year.

Optional. If not provided, all values are assumed to be in real terms, so no inflation adjustment is performed.

forecaster.canada.accounts.rrsp module¶

Provices Registered Retirement Savings Accounts for Canadians.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.rrsp.RRSP(*args, rrif_conversion_year=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.canada.accounts.registered_account.RegisteredAccount

A Registered Retirement Savings Plan (Canada).

__init__(*args, rrif_conversion_year=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initializes an RRSP object.

This class also implements RRIFs (which RRSPs are converted into either at a user-defined time or by operation of law). A new object is not created when the RRSP converts to an RRIF; rather, the object’s behaviour changes to limit inflows, require minimum withdrawals, and reduce withholding taxes.

See documentation for RegisteredAccount for information on args not listed below.

Parameters:rrif_conversion_year (int) – The year in which the RRSP object’s behaviour switches from RRSP rules to RRIF rules.
balance_history¶

Record of balance over all past years.

convert_to_rrif(year=None)[source]¶

Converts the RRSP to an RRIF.

inflows_history¶

Record of inflows over all past years.

min_outflow(when='end')[source]¶

Minimum RRSP withdrawal

next_contribution_room()[source]¶

Determines the amount of contribution room for next year.

Parameters:
  • income (Money) – The amount of taxable income for this year used to calculate RRSP contribution room.
  • year (int) – The year in which the income is received.
Returns:

The contribution room for the RRSP for the year after year.
outflows_history¶

Record of outflows over all past years.

rate_history¶

Record of rate over all past years.

returns_history¶

Record of returns over all past years.

rrif_conversion_year¶

The year in which the RRSP is converted to an RRIF.

If not set explicitly, the owner’s retirement year or year in which conversion is required by law is returned (whichever happens first).

forecaster.canada.accounts.taxable_account module¶

TODO

class forecaster.canada.accounts.taxable_account.TaxableAccount(owner, balance=0, rate=0, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, acb=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.base.Account

A taxable account, non-registered account.

This account uses Canadian rules for determining taxable income from capital assets. That involves tracking the adjusted cost base (acb) of the assets.

See Account for other attributes not listed below.

acb¶

The adjusted cost base of the assets in the account at the start of the year.

Type:Money
capital_gain¶

The total capital gains for the year. This is evaluated lazily, so it may return different values if you add or remove transactions.

Type:Money
__init__(owner, balance=0, rate=0, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, acb=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Constructor for TaxableAccount.

See documentation for Account for information on args not listed below.

Parameters:acb (Money) – The adjusted cost base of the assets in the account at the start of initial_year.
acb

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

acb_history¶

Record of acb over all past years.

add_transaction(value, when='end')[source]¶

Adds a transaction to the account.

Parameters:
  • value (Money) – The value of the transaction. Positive values are inflows and negative values are outflows.
  • when (float, Decimal, str) – The timing of the transaction. Must be in the range [0,1] or be a suitable str input, as described in the documentation for when_conv.
Raises:
  • decimal.InvalidOperation – Transactions must be convertible to type Money and when must be convertible to type Decimal.
  • ValueError – when must be in [0,1]

Module contents¶

A package for providing Canadian accounts of various kinds.
